title: ‘Incredible positive and collaborative culture with inspiring colleagues and leaders.’
pros: Great collaborative working culture. Incredible learning/development and career opportunities.
cons: Legacy fragmented tech stacks. Dated offices, though these are being improved.

title: ‘Great, fun and interesting business to work for’
pros: Outstanding culture, great people, company vision and purpose. It is great to work for an organisation that provides opportunities to their customers to better their future.
cons: Increase in competition is driving a focus on productivity & KPI monitoring

title: ‘All in all I have a great deal of respect for the organisation and it's leadership and it's mission/vision - I really enjoyed being a part of the organisation, I learned far more than I realised (which has been incredibly helpful in my new role at a small’
pros: Good things: The people, the culture; the facilities (showers, kitchen space, coffee machine, breakout room); autonomy within your role and opportunities for professional development; celebrating the holidays, anniversaries and even rolling out new budgets and strategies; transparency from a leadership standpoint; not taking ourselves too seriously, not forgetting to have some fun in your role; company values that are adhered to (which is rare in a large organisation); leaders that will go that extra mile to try and accommodate requests; always working toward continuous improvement; the adaptability of the organisation in a increasingly challenging market whilst maintaining our ethical grounding...
cons:
Personally, in my experience I felt there was a lack of support when I transitioned into a new role via a development opportunity which was a bit disappointing and left me second-guessing my ability.  
Then when my manager was dismissed there was a lack of leadership as my colleague who didn't have any management experience became my interim manager.  He had his hands full juggling his own work and trying his best to manage a team, and as a result our working relationship became a bit strained and I wasn't getting the support I required to deliver in my role to the level I wanted to.  I often felt like I was in the deep-end trying to manage a project beyond my experience level and often felt like I wasn't delivering any real value to the organisation.  I of course realise these things happen when departments undergo sudden change and have to adapt accordingly, but it left me doubting myself which is something I struggled with a bit when looking at new job opportunities post Seek Learning.
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘A complex and engaging workplace ’
pros: Everyone is genuinely engaged in their work and trying their hardest to improve the whole process of finding the right job for both job seekers and hirers. They’re super smart, but also open to hearing what you have to say no matter what your role may be.
cons: It’s such a massive complicated beast that some things can run really slowly. That, and everyone just thinks you’re a recruiter when they find out you work for SEEK.

title: ‘Great place to work, if you want to work at a place that cares and also gets stuff done.’
pros: Great culture. People are driven and motivated by the purpose to help individuals to have more fulfilling working lives; they are also smart, capable humble and compassionate. That combination really works for me.
cons: The business is going through a lot of change - good change. However that always comes with higher levels of ambiguity and the greater need to build and re-build working relationships.

title: ‘A great software development experience with a fun culture’
pros: Great software development culture. All striving to do great things and everyone is accepting of everyone's strengths and weaknesses. There is a strong appetite to grow everyone's careers. Org structure is fairly flat and teams are mostly autonomous meaning we make our own product decisions and technology decisions with guidance. Great culture and people - parties are awesome. Salary and work life balance are absolutely amazing. You're able to work from home whenever you need and there is unlimited sick leave.
cons:
The social culture I would say is fairly mediocre compared to other big companies. Teams are quite self contained and don't really get to know other teams so if you're in a team that doesn't get out much you're not going to socialise much unless you really branch out. Not the best for introverts in that sense. I've met some great friends here though who I fairly often see outside of work.

SEEK legitimately only hire people if they're willing to challenge themselves and step outside their comfort zones. The performance system is well structured now and attempts to look at your gaps and how to fix them.

title: ‘Amazing place to work’
pros: Awesome environment with people who really care about their work and their colleagues - fantastic culture. Great opportunities to move roles internally too
cons: Decision-making can be slow at times, given the size of the organisation and number of stakeholders. Some roles don't have perfect work-life balance (but very good on the whole)

title: ‘Great environment to learn, develop and grow!’
pros: SEEK is a great place to work, where there are a combination of smart people who work hard but also have fun. SEEK is an environment where you have the ability to often shape what you are working on and take opportunities to learn and develop further.
cons: SEEK is not a heavily process driven environment, so if you are someone who likes strict processes and steps to getting things done you may find this challenging.

title: ‘I look forward to coming to work each day.’
pros: My Colleagues are great friends, we represent a great organisation with a humble and passionate founder. I love that I can really believe in our purpose and feel like I am making a positive impact each day..
cons: Being out of head office can sometimes be challenging as opportunities to diversify or change roles are less frequent than for those based out of Melbourne.

title: ‘Excellent way to start a career in online sales’
pros: Excellent commission structure, a fantastic office and fun colleagues. Free breakfast, massages, ping pong and casual clothing.
cons: Very flat org structure in the Sydney office. The pay is great but this means that there are heaps of salespeople and team leaders who have been there in the same role for far, far too long.
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Amazing culture, good opportunities to learn about the business and industry’
pros: Amazing culture, great social and community opportunities. Senior Leadership Team was caring and tends to listen to the employees.
cons: Opportunities for growth and development was average. a disconnect between Senior and Middle management. HR support and advice was poor in a few cases during this time.

title: ‘Whatever your discipline you should aspire to work here.’
pros: Non-hierarchical structure where everyone can contribute ideas. Management has good vision and strategy. Investment in new products has been awesome. International expansion very impressive.
cons: A lot of things happening at once. Resources a little stretched at times but that just adds to the fun really.

title: ‘It was fantastic taking part in this proud work with lovely people on the amazing products.’
pros: Amazing company culture and advanced technologies. It exceded my expectations and was one of the best work experiences
cons: Many professionals, many opinions and not all approaches/concepts can be tested properly.

title: ‘Best culture, staff and all round business I have ever worked in.’
pros: Has won Aon's best employer 10 years in a row for a reason.  Amazing place to work.  Full of smart people, all with a caring and supportive attitudes.  Cant talk more positively about the business.
cons: Only minor challenges exist and in comparison to other businesses in market they are non existent.

title: ‘Fast paced environment with a great culture’
pros: Seek has a strong culture and established values. There is a clearly defined vision and purpose. Management are active across all business units and there is a lot of growth potential for the business.
cons: Seek is expanding rapidly and the pace of this strategy execution is doesn't seem to be balanced with the operational business model. Some roles appear unclear as to their area of remit.

title: ‘Best job I’ve had by far’
pros:
An empowering environment which really leaves little room for any negativity in my opinion. 
Freedom to be yourself, surrounded by great people, fun spaces and awesome events.
Ample opportunities are available to engage with the business and create ideas or initiate changes as well.
cons:
Challenges are addressed very well at SEEK. A suggestion maybe, that customer service could be engaged a little earlier for potential new products/changes and not just after it’s all been done.
Normally things are created and launched without cs input and then we have to take “feedback” (complaints, criticisms) from clients which isn’t always fun.

title: ‘Enjoyable, enlightening and with much room for growth I would consider a long career at SEEK’
pros:
Full diversity - maybe sometime lacking in \"older\" workers.
Great perks - pushes collaboration and team bonding
Autonomy
cons:
Cross team integration 
Near enough is good enough approach
Lack of accountability in some areas - back office functions

title: ‘Amazing place, insanely good culture and great career opportunities’
pros:
The work is super interesting and for a great purpose, helping jobseekers prosper in their careers.   The Product team and capability is very mature so you have an opportunity to learn from some of the best talent in the country.

Last but not least they really care about their employees and have demonstrated this time and time again.
cons: Recognition takes a lot of perseverance. Given the quality and sheer number of fellow product managers it takes a lot to really stand out.

title: ‘Great people to work with who have a passion for helping people find jobs.’
pros: Great work life balance and the opportunity to work with lots of really talented and passionate people
cons: Once had a great culture that made working at Seek fun and rewarding but the culture isn't important to new management who focus only on profit and new product development.

title: ‘The people, atmosphere and problem space at seek has bene great!’
pros: Great people, solving important problems, great culture
cons: Always growing in terms of staff and teams which is awesome, but if means finding space/rooms for meetings etc can sometimes be a challenge

title: ‘Do it’
pros: Great people, great culture, great challenges. Fast paced and high expectations, but also trust and a supportive environment, especially when you have to make things happen.
cons: Everyone is in top gear all the time, it's hard to keep up.

title: ‘Seek is a happy, diverse, fast paced and inspiring place to work’
pros: A company that genuinely cares about its staff but also every person searching for a job or ideal candidate. Day to day staff benefits are incredible.
cons: The onboarding process of staff when I originally started wasn't great, I felt like an outlier and unsupported. Thankfully this is actively being changed.

title: ‘Great company, great future lies ahead.’
pros: The corporate culture is the best i've ever experienced. A really great outlook for the company due to very smart and dedicated people with a clear vision.
cons: Some senior managers are too indecisive & tend to critique, rather than lead. While pay is slightly above the industry average, it could be better to attract/retain more talent, as seen elsewhere in what is quite a competitive industry.

title: ‘Leaving SEEK is & always will be one of the biggest regrets of my life. Trust me, the grass isn’t greener. Still I touch with some of the best friends I’ve ever made & some of the best years of my life.’
pros: Great people. Amazing culture. Excellent product. Happy customers.
cons: New staff not recognising the efforts of long term. People that work there generally stay a long time so it’s hard to move around.

title: ‘Great company with many benefits & perks along with a brilliant culture’
pros: Excellent work/life balance. Culture & benefits + perks are right up there with the best companies
cons: Turning into a very corporate company & need to make sure they don't lose sight of what made Seek so great

title: ‘Extremely supportive and amazing work culture’
pros: Amazing team to work with, Management actually care and invest time in your development.
cons: Taking on extra work on top of your current workload

title: ‘Best company I have ever worked for’
pros: Very laid-back atmosphere, healthy work-life balance, diversity valued. The company is very generous with their benefits and perks. Fantastic amount of transparency with what's going on around the wider company with regular product showcases, Q&A sessions and talks. Fun off-site events like team-building days and carnivals. Redundancies/restructures appear to be a very rare occurrence. It's these sorts of things that make employees want to give their utmost in the work that they do.
cons: Too early in my tenure to find anything that stands out at this stage. Many challenges seem to be addressed quite well at SEEK.

title: ‘A career highlight being part of this business - dont expect another company will ever compare’
pros:
Great strategy ang highly successful
Relentless focus on doing the right things for long term success not short term bottom line
cons: Promotion at senior levels

title: ‘Simply a great place to come to work everyday’
pros: Smart people, world-class products, awesome working environment, executive team is very team strong
cons: Moving from an Australian focused business to a global market means it challenging to keep to great family, startup feel culture

title: ‘My dream job!’
pros: Amazing culture, exciting work, progressive organization and employees (and diversity) are truly valued.
cons: The challenges aren’t negative, but I’m stimulated by the work and the fast-paced environment which can be challenging at times but in a positive way.

title: ‘Awesome place to work’
pros: Great place to work with excellent culture. People are motivated to succeed and are passionate about the business and what it stands for.
cons: Like any business growing from a start-up to a large company there are some operational challenges.

title: ‘The best corporate to work for in Australia.’
pros: Surrounded by great people, and a compelling purpose to work towards every day. Also access to a host of smaller start-ups that seek owns for great career opportunities.
cons: Some people here are attracted by perks and not necessarily as driven as others

title: ‘Like family. Wonderful people, awesome technology and great business’
pros: Great culture, wonderful leadership team. Very customer focused and terrific career opportunities for committed high performers
cons: As it's a relatively flat structure, there is only so far you can go in terms of moving up the tree

title: ‘Making a difference in people's lives while being yourself at work.’
pros: A great people focus from leadership. Long term view placing customers before profits.
cons: Sometimes innovation is a bit too constrained.

title: ‘A company that respects and rewards employees - wouldn't work anywhere else, except if I wanted to move overseas’
pros: Way they treat employees
cons: Reporting capabilities

title: ‘Would recommend anyone to come and work at Seek’
pros: Challenging work, with big clients, and great people around the place
cons: As the economy gets weaker the targets remain high. But fair.

title: ‘A place to learn, challange and to be challanged.’
pros: A welcoming environment, with an opportunity to develop and help SEEK users.
cons: Large teams sometimes, which makes decision making slow.

title: ‘It doesn't feel like work.’
pros: The people are amazing,  and the opportunities are there if you want them.
cons: Finding a more manageable work/life balance

title: ‘It's a cult.’
pros: Free food, the christmas party, hackathons, colleagues
cons: Seek likes to describe themselves as a start-up company due to the culture and 'hip' working environment but, let's be honest, in a business with 900 employees, you're still just a number.  management, in my experience, was not great and i was made to feel like i was never good enough.

title: ‘Don't miss out on a working at SEEK experience!’
pros: Great people to work with and exicting problems to solve!
cons: Can sometimes be difficult to navigate the myriad of decision makers and opinion holders. Get ready to get your stakeholder on!

title: ‘Have been able to grow a career at SEEK’
pros: The best people in the business - like minded peers - focused on the client rather than profit
cons: Transport is a challenge if you want to catch public transport (train) as located outside of the CBD

title: ‘Good place to work.’
pros: Funky office, good culture, flexible work hours.
cons: Could be a bit closer to the CBD.

title: ‘I've worked in Melbourne at various dotcoms over the last 20 years, and SEEK is unreservedly the best company I've worked for’
pros: The best collaborative people that you can grow with
cons: The location is not the easiest to commute to.

title: ‘Nice team first culture’
pros: Great environment with wonderful culture
cons: Difficulty advancing anywhere internally

title: ‘Nice place to work’
pros: Good environment. Lots of things to learn and equality is being promoted.
cons: Peer pressure. You get the perks and feel obliged to do more!

title: ‘Totes awes’
pros: Awesome people, Awesome culture, awesome perks
cons: Challenging​ work with new stack

title: ‘Proud to be part of a great Australian company’
pros: Incredible brand always evolving and great leadership from the top
cons: Technology challenges in the regions

title: ‘Great corporate culture. It’s fun to be a part of something big.’
pros: Massive business with many opportunities, very social, enjoyable work environment. Fantastic employee perks
cons:
Highly dependent on the team you work in. I found the work to be very slow and did not feel very engaged.

Team relations were occasionally strained

title: ‘Great tech startup but steps towards corporatising could make it less fun in a few years’
pros: Great people, income protection insurance, travel insurance, personal dev presentations, tons of events
cons: Office is pretty old, insufficient meeting rooms, business is corporatising (so more restructures, more layers, etc)

title: ‘Great company’
pros: The people are amazing and feel empowered to work to their potential
cons: We are trying to do so many things and this can create challenges

title: ‘A job to make it easier for others to get jobs’
pros:
Management look long term - not driven by short term profits. 
Great culture, smart people
cons: Lots going on at any one time

title: ‘Great company to work for’
pros: It's great to work with so many smart, talented and nice people
cons: It can take a long thing to get things done!

title: ‘Good place to grow’
pros: Flexible working hour, unlimited sick leave, work from home, agile
cons: Work hard, care about people, be productive

title: ‘I have my dream job in a wonderful company.’
pros: An inclusive, supportive and highly motivating working environment. The work flexibility is also fantastic.
cons: Product lead organisation so marketing is often treated as second fiddle

title: ‘The early days were the best days.’
pros: Some of the team leaders were great and supported their team
cons: Politics in the place. Favoritism and not giving the tools for the consultants to hit their targets.

title: ‘Love my time ’
pros: Culture and strong support for staff
cons: Strategy and tech lead.  Hard for people outside of these disciplines

title: ‘So much support and opportunity’
pros: The people are amazing. All a grade players who inspire you to grow. Certainly know how to have a laugh!
cons: Recently transitioned to an agile work environment but some people still think in waterfall. Getting better though!

title: ‘There is something special here.’
pros: Working with the most passionate and intelligent teams. The culture of SEEK would be very hard to replicate, there is something special about everyone that makes this place tick!
cons: Out growing the building, this means some teams are offsite and we can't get meeting rooms for client meetings.

title: ‘One of the best places I have ever worked.’
pros: Definitely the people and the business purpose/mission statement & values are meaningful.
cons: Location could be better (i.e. Cbd).

title: ‘Unreal’
pros: Culture is great and people are amazing and professional
cons: Agile approach sometimes gets a bit hectic

title: ‘Amazing!’
pros: Great company - flexible work solutions, good careers progression opportunities and meaningful purpose
cons: The product suite can sometimes feel limited and the company is so focussed on fairness and equality they sometimes go too far the other way..

title: ‘The greatest Company in the world’
pros: Love the culture and team i work with
cons: Although my TL drives for career opportunity, my current development plan doesn't allow for much practical experience

title: ‘One of the better places I've worked.’
pros: Great people, enjoyable work and they treat their employees well.
cons: As a developer there are too many meetings. Consistency and quality across teams can vary

title: ‘Work with Great and intelligent people’
pros: Perks, social, great people, causal office
cons: Management, regulation, company forgetting its people, lack of autonomy and trust

title: ‘Incredible company with a people first culture ’
pros: Management, inclusive culture, incredible perks, celebrates success
cons: High rents toon rate so limited career opportunities

title: ‘Unbeatable place to work’
pros: Amazing culture, purpose driven, and fast-paced environment that gets things done
cons: Need to earn your stripes

title: ‘Far and away the best workplace I have experienced’
pros: Collaborative working culture, great environment and the latest technology
cons: Only negative is the St Kilda Rd location

title: ‘Assimilate or die (inside). ’
pros: Small company feel. Great perks. Beer on Friday.
cons: Ruthless senior management with little appreciation for diverse points of view.

title: ‘Awesome’
pros: Senior management set a great direction and live and breath the values expected by all staff.
cons: Too many cool things to work on and so little time to get across all of it.

title: ‘Great culture, smart people but extremely extreme’
pros: People and culture are great! Management is prudent and has common sense
cons: Sometimes there is just too much talking and not enough doing. Other times, there's too much doing and not enough talking. There doesn't seem to be any middle ground.

title: ‘For work life balance, recognition, appreciation and development, you could not ask for more.’
pros: There is no discrimination between \"us\" and \"them\".  All opinions are valid.
cons: Lack of structure, rules, guidelines, best practice, seem to reinvent the wheel each time

title: ‘Great company, they have just got the recipe right’
pros: Fun culture, fast paced. Good performance management process, focus on finding the right answer first and sticking the course in the long run.
cons: Hard to understand the technology side of the business sometimes.

title: ‘Will never leave’
pros: Work life balance, culture, a CEO that inspires and cares about people
cons: As the business grows we need to evolve our culture for the good and educate any new comers on the great things that make SEEK so unique

title: ‘Somewhere you want to walk into every morning’
pros: Excellent culture, great people and a warm environment
cons: Understanding developmental opportunities - there's so many people and so many facets of the business that it can be difficult to get your head around!

title: ‘Overall a positive experience except for the drop in pay for working hard’
pros: Great crew in various departments. Had a chance to assist others to improve themselves
cons: The toe cutters Mercer came in and assisted SEEK to reduce our salary and commission because we were the Inside Sales crew and not the Outside Sales people even though we were the accountable people at the desk every day.

title: ‘Hands down the best place I've worked.’
pros: Seek has a team of passionate and dedicated people who give their best, each and every day. It is inspirational and so motivating to be surrounded by such people.
cons: Because we have so many projects on the go at once, it can be difficult to focus. Also, the priorities are constantly changing which makes it challenging for many teams and individuals to keep focused on what is most important at any one time

title: ‘Love what I do and where I do it.’
pros: Work life balance is awesome. Great R&R benefits. Well regarded brand.
cons: Regional location makes career progression difficult unless you can be mobile.

title: ‘Great fun culture, with a lot of opportunity to grow outside of your day to day role.’
pros: The culture is amazing. Open and accepting of all people. Gives everyone a great opportunity to be themselves at work. Great career development
cons: Management could be a challenge depending on the role. Some are great. Others are micro-managers.

title: ‘A dynamic fun yet busy and challenging company  to work’
pros: You can wear short and bring your dog to work. open desk policy,free food and drinks, lots of opportunities for career and personal development
cons: Result driven, fast paced, ever changing, Google like .

title: ‘Great place to work.’
pros: Awesome people, awesome culture. The company actually cares for its employees.
cons: None that I can think of.

title: ‘Best company I've worked for. Can't recommend SEEK highly enough.’
pros: Excellent leadership team, amazing product development, regular perks, fantastic people to work with.
cons: Nothing negative at all. All challenges are positive ones.

title: ‘The best company I've ever worked for in every regard, with a great purpose and culture’
pros:
- Really smart, motivated people across the entire business
- Small company values retained as they've grown -- people know your name and care about you and your development
- Truly meritocratic with lots of opportunities
- You're helping real people get jobs and improve their lives
- Little / no politics even at the highest levels
cons: While opportunities abound, SEEK has a pretty flat organizational structure so if role titles matter to your sense of professional and personal development, it may not be the place for you.

title: ‘So far so good’
pros: Great people doing great things, great perks as well. Working with some very smart talented people.
cons: Seek does not always pull in the same direction, and he who shouts the loudest seems to win at times.

title: ‘Great place to work!’
pros: Great culture, very smart people, cutting edge technologies
cons: Not the easiest to get to location

title: ‘The best job I have ever had.’
pros: An amazing company that supports everyone to achieve their goals. It is a very collaborative place to work.
cons: There is constantly change within the business. You need to be be comfortable with this, otherwise it could be challenging.

title: ‘Good to be in SEEK as permanent employee, but not as contractor’
pros: Friendly work environment, good technology
cons: Stability in the job because of short rolling contract

title: ‘Work hard, play hard and some down time here and there but overall excellent place to work’
pros: Seek knows how to celebrate success and treat their staff with lots of perks and work events activities
cons: Keeping up with new technologies and delivering high quality work in a fast paced environment

title: ‘Overall good place to work that offers work life balance.’
pros: Prople & Culture is great
cons: Fewer development opportunities.

title: ‘Great palce to work where successes and failures are celebrated; the focus is on innovation not outcome.’
pros: Culture, progressive attitude throughout the business, sense of ownership and accountability
cons: Gaining engagement from product and strategy for customer specific activity

title: ‘Best company to work’
pros: Flexible working time and good team work
cons: Have to keep ourself with new progranming languages & skills

title: ‘Fun and innovative working environment’
pros:
Great place to work, where everyone you work with is exceptional at what they do. 
Plus they have flexi time, drinks on Friday, and not forgetting the slide!!!!
cons: Leaving work on time because your having so much fun!

title: ‘It's the most generous and caring company I have ever worked for.’
pros: All of it. I have no complaints.
cons: Entitlement culture that nearly always  pervade organisations that have it so good.

title: ‘Good pay, good culture but not great individuals.’
pros: Good culture and pay
cons: Backend systems teams are poor

title: ‘Feel very lucky to call SEEK my employer.’
pros: Truly innovative company that never sits still.
cons: Resilience - as disrupters who disrupt ourselves and the market everyone needs a high level of resilience.

title: ‘Being able to do things in a flexible way.’
pros: Being able to work in calm environment.
cons: Having to complete all the required tasks in one day.

title: ‘Purposeful and challenging work, good fun and great people’
pros: Incredible inclusion, diversity and flexibility. Through codifying its culture, SEEK has made it really simple to understand what high performance means within the business and how to achieve it.
cons: The continual strive for excellence with high agility can leave you feeling overwhelmed at times

title: ‘Great perks and laughs but not great fir long time career’
pros: Great perks and laughs
cons: Promotion seems to be how well you are friends with the bosses, and management not on yr ability, very disappointing to see good hard workers who are talented not get achance because of this.

title: ‘A great place for a high achiever to call home’
pros:
Challenging and engaging work
great people
great vibe
helping people
cons:
Nothing.

well, challenging work. but that's not a challenge in a bad way. its a good challenge because you get to use your noggin to overcome roadblocks and find new and better ways to do things.

title: ‘Best company ever worked for - and potentially one of the best across AU’
pros: Great company, great culture and supportive management team
cons: None

title: ‘A great place to work’
pros: Great culture in the office. We work hard, and we get to play hard. People understand that work can be fun and productive at the same time. I feel very valued as an employee, which some organisations aren't very good at.
cons: As with any organisation that's grown large, at times things can take longer than they would in a smaller organisation.

title: ‘Great company and good dynamic environment’
pros: Working environments and directions from senior mgt.
cons: Work-life balance is a challenge

title: ‘An excellent company to work for!’
pros: Excellent team of people to work with. Upper management really care about their staff so the culture is one of support and positivity (and fun).
cons: The company's output of products has increased to the point that there is no down time. Everyday is a busy day at SEEK.

title: ‘Solve hard problems with great people and learn a lot.’
pros: Clever, supportive people. Great perks. Interesting problems to solve.
cons: The Melbourne office is pretty cramped and not a lot of quiet, private space to work.

title: ‘Your experience working at SEEK is entirely what you make it.’
pros:
Autonomy. 
Career development support. 
Your voice will be heard.
cons: The lines between work and play can be blurry.

title: ‘I don't ever want to leave.’
pros: Working at SEEK is like working for a big family where we all work hard and are supported and rewarded for doing so.
cons: None.

title: ‘Very positive, I enjoyed it emmensly, a great team!!’
pros: The people were fantastic and always ready to have a joke and enjoy things even through intensely busy periods
cons: Communication was sometimes a bit of a challenge and sometimes  resulted on impacts of the quality of work

title: ‘Best workplace I’ve ever experienced.’
pros: People, culture, benefits, fun!
cons: Looking forward to moving to a bigger office.

title: ‘Number 1 company I've work with !’
pros: Great management who have a genuine interest in developing their staff and a great place to further your career
cons: No major challenges, just the fact that the nature of the business you're required to work on a rotating roster.

title: ‘Great company with even better people!’
pros: I thoroughly enjoy coming into work everyday. A great company with great people!
cons: Hard to think of something..

title: ‘Great vision, fun parties but culture isn’t nurturing and supportive’
pros:
Vision of the company
Fun parties and events
cons: Limited opportunities for career development and management unsupportive of different leadership styles

title: ‘Fantastics company with great ambition and drive that doesn't come at the expense of its culture and people.’
pros: Fantastic company to work for, one of the few tech company that is really innovative and has ambitions on the global stage.
cons: Always more opportunities that what we can actually pursue, regardless how much we keep increasing our capabilities

title: ‘Fast-paced, energetic and extremely rewarding.’
pros: The people at SEEK are something special.
cons: Keeping up in an agile environment!

title: ‘Great experience and place to work’
pros: Culture and peaople
cons: Long working hours

title: ‘Exciting technology company with great, passionate people’
pros: Great people, passionate about doing great work and achieving great outcomes for our customers, and about the craft of technology.
cons: Nothing major. Some change management could be handled better, but the intent is good.

title: ‘Awesome place. Love it!’
pros: Great people, solving real problems. Flexible working policies with a focus on G.S.D rather than clock watching.
cons: Sometimes it feels like we take too long to make decisions. While it's important to do the thinking up front, this needs to be moderated to ensure we don't move slowly.

title: ‘Most forward-thinking company I've worked for!’
pros: The training is very comprehensive, the staff are lovely and the facilities are incredible!
cons: There aren't any negative challenges!

title: ‘Brilliant business with good people making a difference!’
pros: The purpose, having an impact on helping people find great jobs, it’s powerful . The culture is very inclusive and caring
cons: Career progression can be difficult due to the lack of senior roles across the business

title: ‘Highly recommend’
pros: An awesome company to work for!!
cons: Not that I can think of. Fabulous employer!

title: ‘Awesome’
pros: Seek is an amazing place to work at with very nice people and great benefits
cons: Career progression can be difficult due low turnover

title: ‘Great!’
pros: Great brand, great people, lots of passion, variety and challenge available if you are open to it.
cons: It’s not a start up any more. Currently out grown its work environment but a new state of the art site is being developed - lots of new management (not bad just a challenge to settle into it)

title: ‘Great place to work’
pros:
Founder led business, even after 20 years
Smart, humble people
Strong organisational purpose
Adoption of new technologies and techniques
cons:
Growing at a fast pace has come with growing pains 

Strategy led company, can feel like you struggle to influence without an MBA or experience in a top tier consulting firm.

title: ‘Great team, learnt A LOT, fast paced, can be stressful and challenging. ’
pros:
The conferences are awesome with amazing accomodation, great learning sessions and culture building activities. 

It's a fast paced environment so you'll never get bored. 

My team was very supportive and were flexible with my work arrangements well beyond any other company I've ever worked for. *This may not be the same across every team* 

SEEK is inclusive and genuinely wants to match the right candidate to the right job. Educating employers on the issues surrounding "unconcious bias" and putting tools in place to help minimise it was particularly rewarding to be a part of. You see many POC, people with diabilities and different age ranges working at Seek.
cons:
Budgets became near impossible to achieve in the last few years of working there- this was felt across all sales teams. It meant I had to take my work home with me a lot and it was difficult to navigate the cause of the issue with management. 

It's so fast paced that sometimes products/services are released before everyone - including managers- are fully across them which can be frustrating as it happens often and can be very confusing. 

Management is thinley stretched so you need to be quite autonomous. 
This was fine for me but many scenarios that would've been less of a strain if management had time to manage. 

If you want career development, know that this is easier to achieve in the Melbourne office (HQ), in other regional offices this will be a challenge. 

If you're outside of HQ, the training falls on the team which can mean that your work suffers until the new person can fly over for a formal induction which can take months. Hopefully this will be fixed. 

Pay needs to be more equal amoungst people in the same team doing the same work.

title: ‘SEEK embodies opportunity. Perfect place to create your own definition of a working life.’
pros:
The flexibility and opportunity to create your own definition of a working life.
Amazing for pro-active individuals. Feels like a start-up with a great culture.
cons: Too much flexibility and opportunity without structure just creates a lack of consistency. Changes take waaaaaay too long to implement.

title: ‘Best job I’ve had and company I’ve worked for, with brilliant colleagues.’
pros:
The culture is hard to describe, but it is unique, engaging and fun. I’d say it is SEEK’s best feature for sure. I think it favours a-type personalities though and means that those who don’t want to engage with a very social culture could feel left behind.
I’ve done jobs that I never thought I could do, and was supported the entire way through.
cons: A start up vibe trying to exist in a big business. I think the growing pains are starting to ease though, and there is benefit in working for a big business.

title: ‘Seek remains  the BEST’
pros: Jobs n learning opportunities
cons: Meeting up with challenging  task  n ability to use initiative

cons: Might be a bit slow pace at times, given it a large company and highly collaborative.
